title: Drawing, Design for Two-part Corner Cabinet, 1900–05
medium: Pen and black ink on thin cream paper
markings: Watermark across verso bottom : ORIENTAL LINEN
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, upper right of design with arrow pointing to glass door: LEAD glazing & white crack; at lower right of design with arrow: TO BE THREE SHELVES IN / lower part; at lower left corner of sheet: ...[?]er cabinet
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Tall corner cabinet consisting of lower triangular-shaped cupboard with 2 front glass doors and 2 shelves which hold pieces of china; canted corners and molded top, surmounted by separate conforming top cupboard  with arch-like front glass doors and raised on triangular back board decorated with carved spandrels on either side.  Lower cabinet has large bowl and pair of cups atop and top cabinet surmounted by porcelain vase.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for Two-part Corner Cabinet, 1900–05. Pen and black ink on thin cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-223.
